name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride oral solution indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: dilute prior . ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) monitor serum potassium adjust accordingly . ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) treatment hypokalemia : adults : initial doses range 40 100 meq/day 2 5 divided doses : limit doses 40 meq per dose . total daily dose exceed 200 meq ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : 2 4 meq/kg/day divided doses ; exceed 1 meq/kg single dose 40 meq whichever lower ; deficits severe ongoing losses great , consider intravenous therapy . total daily dose exceed 100 meq ( 2.3 ) maintenance prophylaxis hypokalemia : adults : typical dose 20 meq per day ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : typical dose 1 meq/kg/day . exceed 3 meq/kg/day ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride oral solution , usp orange solution available two strengths follows : 10 % : 20 meq/15 ml oral solutionndc # 60505-6184-6 bottle 473 ml 20 % : 40 meq/15 ml oral solutionndc # 60505-6185-6 bottle 473 ml storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp . protect light freezing . apotex inc. potassium chloride oral solution , usp 10 % 20 % manufactured : manufactured : apotex inc. apotex corp. toronto , ontario weston , florida canada m9l 1t9 usa 33326 revised : july 2022 rev . 5
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients potassium sparing diuretics .
indications_original: Potassium chloride oral solution is indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction are insufficient.
contraindications_original: Dilute prior to administration. ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosage accordingly. ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) Treatment of hypokalemia: Adults: Initial doses range from 40 to 100 mEq/day in 2 to 5 divided doses: limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. Total daily dose should not exceed 200 mEq ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: 2 to 4 mEq/kg/day in divided doses; not to exceed 1 mEq/kg as a single dose or 40 mEq whichever is lower; if deficits are severe or ongoing losses are great, consider intravenous therapy. Total daily dose should not exceed 100 mEq ( 2.3 ) Maintenance or Prophylaxis of hypokalemia: Adults: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: typical dose is 1 mEq/kg/day. Do not  exceed 3 mEq/kg/day ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium chloride oral solution, USP is an orange solution available in two strengths as follows:
                  10%: 20 mEq/15 mL oral solutionNDC# 60505-6184-6 Bottle of 473 mL
                  20%: 40 mEq/15 mL oral solutionNDC# 60505-6185-6 Bottle of 473 mL
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP. PROTECT from LIGHT and FREEZING.
                  
                  
                     APOTEX INC.
                  
                  
                     POTASSIUM CHLORIDE ORAL SOLUTION, USP
                  
                  
                     10% and 20%

adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on potassium sparing diuretics.
